text: Brickellia stolonifera is a Mexican species of flowering plants in the daisy family. It has been found only in the state of Coahuila in north-central Mexico.Turner, B. L. 1997. The Comps of Mexico: A systematic account of the family Asteraceae, vol. 1 – Eupatorieae. Phytologia Memoirs 11: i–iv, 1–272 Brickellia stolonifera is similar to a species from nearby Chihuahua, B. simplex, but it has opposite leaves and flower heads grouped at the end of branches instead of in the axils of the leaves.Turner, Billie Lee 1982. Phytologia 52: 252-254 diagnosis in Latin, description and commentary in English, full-page line drawing on page 254 ==References== stolonifera Category:Flora of Coahuila Category:Plants described in 1982
title: Brickellia stolonifera
